Module com.jlbabilino.json
Package com.jlbabilino.json

Class JSONParser

java.lang.Object
com.jlbabilino.json.JSONParser
public class JSONParser extends Object
This class takes a String in the format of JSON, parses it, and outputs its equivalent in this library. This is only possible if the String is valid JSON data. If it is not, a JSONParserException will be thrown to indicate the issue to the user. This is the first part of the first essential part of this library; it allows you to interface Java code with other computer applications through Strings and files.
See Also:
JSONSerializer, JSONDeserializer

    • parseJSONEntry

      public static JSONEntry parseJSONEntry​(String jsonString) throws NullPointerException, JSONParserException
      Parses a String containing JSON data as a JSONEntry to be used with this library.
      Parameters:
      jsonString - the String data to parse from
      Returns:
      the parsed JSONEntry
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the input is null
      JSONParserException - if there is a syntax error in the string data

    • parseJSONEntry

      public static JSONEntry parseJSONEntry​(File jsonFile) throws NullPointerException, IOException, JSONParserException
      Loads and parses a File containing JSON data as a JSONEntry to be used with this library.
      Parameters:
      jsonFile - the File to parse from
      Returns:
      the parsed JSONEntry
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the input is null
      IOException - if there is an error loading the file
      JSONParserException - if there is a syntax error in the string data

    • nullEntry

      protected JSONEntry nullEntry() throws JSONParserException

      Precondition: charAt(index) must be 'n'

      This method verifies that the string at the index equals "null", skips past the null and returns JSONNull.NULL. If the string does not equal "null", throws a JSONParserException

      Returns:
      JSONNull.NULL
      Throws:
      JSONParserException - if the string does not contain "null"
